org.hkijena.jipipe.api.data.storage

Interface JIPipeDataStorage

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Closeable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    JIPipeReadDataStorage, JIPipeWriteDataStorage
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    JIPipeFileSystemReadDataStorage, JIPipeFileSystemWriteDataStorage, JIPipeZIPReadDataStorage, JIPipeZIPWriteDataStorage

    public interface JIPipeDataStorage
extends AutoCloseable, Closeable
    A storage for serialized JIPipeData

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Path getFileSystemPath()
      Returns a path on the file system where data can be read/written This path is always ensured to exist.
      Path getInternalPath()
      The current path relative to the root storage
      JIPipeProgressInfo getProgressInfo()
      Returns the JIPipeProgressInfo instance where information is logged
      boolean isFileSystemPathInitialized()
      Returns true if the file system path is initialized.
      default Path relativeToAbsolute(Path path)
      Converts a path relative to this storage into a path that is relative to the root storage.

      • Methods inherited from interface java.io.Closeable

        close

    • Method Detail

      • getProgressInfo

        JIPipeProgressInfo getProgressInfo()
        Returns the JIPipeProgressInfo instance where information is logged
        Returns:
        the JIPipeProgressInfo instance

      • isFileSystemPathInitialized

        boolean isFileSystemPathInitialized()
        Returns true if the file system path is initialized. For example, for certain storage modes, the storage backend might require to create such a storage, which slows down the file operations.
        Returns:
        if the file system path is initialized

      • getFileSystemPath

        Path getFileSystemPath()
        Returns a path on the file system where data can be read/written This path is always ensured to exist. If possible, please use stream-based methods, as the backend might require additional operations to create a file system.
        Returns:
        the path

      • getInternalPath

        Path getInternalPath()
        The current path relative to the root storage
        Returns:
        the path relative to the root storage

      • relativeToAbsolute

        default Path relativeToAbsolute(Path path)
        Converts a path relative to this storage into a path that is relative to the root storage.
        Parameters:
        path - the relative path. must be relative to this storage.
        Returns:
        the path relative to the root storage
